abstract: A consortium led by the private equity firm, J. C. Flowers, offered $50 a share in cash for Sallie Mae, below the $60 a share they agreed to pay in April.
snippet: A consortium led by the private equity firm, J. C. Flowers, offered $50 a share in cash for Sallie Mae, below the $60 a share they agreed to pay in April.
lead_paragraph: In the tense dance over the $25 billion buyout of Sallie Mae, the would-be buyers have tried a new step.

headline.main: Buyout Group Alters Its Offer for Sallie Mae
headline.print_headline: Buyout Group Alters Its Offer for Sallie Mae

byline.original: By Andrew Ross Sorkin and Michael J. de la Merced
